test_cases.title: Common Code Issue Detection
test_cases.description: Test if the system successfully identifies common code issues like code smells or bugs.
validation_rules: Identify at least 5 common code issues across multiple coding languages
Properly flag and report these issues to the user
The system should not report false positives

test_cases.title: Clear and Actionable Feedback
test_cases.description: Test whether the feedback provided by the system is clear and actionable for developers to understand and implement.
validation_rules: Generated feedback should be clear and precise
Feedback should suggest ways to resolve identified issues
Feedback should reference relevant best practices or coding standards

test_cases.title: Coding Standard Enforcement
test_cases.description: Verify if the system consistently enforces standard coding practices across different programming languages.
validation_rules: System should analyse code changes for adherence to standard coding practices
Non-adherence to standards should be flagged and reported
Feedback for non-adherence should provide correct standard to follow

test_cases.title: Security Issue Detection
test_cases.description: Check that the system properly detects potential security issues in code such as vulnerabilities, exploits or weak code.
validation_rules: System should detect common security concerns and threats
Provided feedback should clearly explain detected concern
Feedback should suggest proper coding strategies to negate threat

test_cases.title: Review Metric Improvement
test_cases.description: Ensure that the system's review metrics show improvement over time with consistent use.
validation_rules: System should generate and track review metrics over time
Metrics should show an improving trend with continued use
Declining or stagnant metrics should trigger system alerts for corrective measures

test_cases.title: Error Handling
test_cases.description: Test the system's capability to handle edge cases and errors efficiently. For example, the system is given indecipherable or incompatible code.
validation_rules: System should handle errors gracefully and provide clear error messages
System should not crash on receiving incompatible code
System should flag indecipherable or incompatible code

test_cases.title: Detailed Security Check Information
test_cases.description: Verify if the system provides detailed information about specific security checks performed during code review.
validation_rules: System should provide clear, specific details about security checks
Details should include information about common vulnerability types, security patterns, and best practices
System should not provide only generic descriptions of vulnerabilities

test_cases.title: Security Check Information for Different Languages
test_cases.description: Verify if the system appropriately reports detailed security check information across different coding languages.
validation_rules: Language-specific security checks should be identified and reported
Reporting should include detailed information for each language-specific test
System should not give vague or incorrect information for various languages

test_cases.title: Detailed Vulnerability Report
test_cases.description: Test that the system generates comprehensive reports of detected vulnerabilities, including the type of vulnerability, location in the code, and measures to fix it.
validation_rules: Reports should detail the specific type and location of each detected vulnerability
Each reported vulnerability should have suggested remedial actions
The system should not report false positives in the vulnerability report

test_cases.title: Issue Prioritization
test_cases.description: Test that the system adequately prioritizes code issues from more critical bugs to lesser style issues.
validation_rules: Issue prioritization should be based on the severity of the issue
Critical bugs and security issues should be displayed first
Minor style issues should be displayed last

test_cases.title: Issue Categorization
test_cases.description: Verify the system categorizes issues accurately to make it easier to focus on a specific issue type.
validation_rules: System should group issues into categories according to their type (critical bugs, security issues, style issues, etc.)
Each category must list its issues from most to least severe
Categories must be easily selectable to allow focusing on a specific issue type

test_cases.title: Mixed Issue Handling
test_cases.description: Test if the system can handle a mix of severe and minor issues without treating them as having equal priority.
validation_rules: All detected issues should be clearly displayed and categorised
Critical and security issues should be listed before minor and style ones
Feedback regarding critical issues should not be diluted in the presence of style and minor issues

test_cases.title: Style Issue Prioritization
test_cases.description: Ensure style issues are identified and correctly assigned a lower priority, but still included in the overall code quality metrics.
validation_rules: Style issues should be detected and reported, not omitted
Style issues should be lower priority than critical bugs
Metrics should reflect the number and severity of style issues in the code
